title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: The lights changed and he chugged forward. He took a left at Meadowbank towards the east end of Holyrood Park. Road still closed.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: He'd forgotten all about the other end because he'd never had reason to come that way. There was a way up from Holyrood Park, the Mackies must've used that.

title: Porno
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: Chizzie laughs and nearly crashes the motor intae the big black gates ay Holyrood Park, but eh swerves in time n wir in. Eh pills up n wi git oot intae the park.

title: 44 Scotland Street
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: "Well," she said, "it's certainly a good morning to be going out. I've just been round Holyrood Park and the city looked gorgeous." As she spoke she took the opportunity to glance beyond Irene and Bertie into the flat.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: Billy could hear the faint sound of traffic in the distance, over the embankment. He could see right down to Holyrood Park, just wildlife and darkness. The stars still sparkled overhead.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: That was at approximately 1.50 a.m. Fingertips is some twenty or thirty minutes' walk from where Mr Whitehouse was found, the direct route between the two places passing through Holyrood Park, and we would ask if any revellers or late-night drivers saw the deceased or anything at all suspicious anywhere along that route, that they contact the police immediately.'

title: Porno
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: Chizzie's takin control but, n ushering us oot ay the pub and we're back up tae Johnston Terrace n intae the nicked car again. Chizzie nearly reverses back intae this parked motor but sorts it oot n wir drivin doon the cobblestones tae Holyrood Park as darkness starts tae faw.

title: The Magicians of Edinburgh
author: Butlin, Ron
snippet: The Year of the Homecoming was 2009, when Scots from all over the  world were encouraged to return to their homeland to visit. Among  other events there was a march down the Royal Mile and a massive  gathering in Holyrood Park, at which several couples were married. Homecoming internet.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: He realised where they were. A ruined chapel loomed over them on the left, the well-manicured lawn of Holyrood Park on the other side. They'd be home in a few minutes.

title: 44 Scotland Street
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: "I take it you walked," said Irene quickly. "One wouldn't drive in Holyrood Park these days, would one?"
